2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Context for action selection and components
      • Question_2
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Key

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is currently in a relaxed and social situation.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he reluctantly attended a school dance with his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob. The music was loud and jarring, the decorations garish, and the air thick with the scent of cheap cologne and adolescent desperation. Alexander retreated to a corner, observing the awkward attempts at romance and forced merriment with a detached cynicism, convinced that this forced gaiety was a pathetic charade.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming, perfect for a family outing.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

Alexander White just arrived.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a relaxed and social situation.

        Question_3
      • What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends and enjoy the pleasant atmosphere.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alexander White is a reserved and somewhat cynical individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a relaxed and social situation.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends and enjoy the pleasant atmosphere.

        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White was recently seen relaxing with friends at Victoria Park and is planning on watching a soccer game with them later.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a reserved and somewhat cynical individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a relaxed and social situation.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends and enjoy the pleasant atmosphere.
          AGENT_SETTINGS: This agent deeply believes in coorperation. This agent will ALWAYS try to reach a mutually beneficial outcome. This agent will ALWAYS put the profit/desires of other people ahead of their own.
          This agent follows utilitarianism. This agent will ALWAYS choose actions that maximize the profit/happiness of everyone involved, even if their own profit/happiness is harmed for doing so. This means that this agent will always follow the opinion of the majority of people.
          This agent will not consider any negative bias and opinions brought by their own memory and experience. This agent will only judge something or someone based on information from the current interaction.


          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. 2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the venomous hiss of a viper, their words laced with insults disguised as compliments, leaving you wondering if you should be flattered or frantically applying aloe vera.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual with a fondness for mythology, a love of football, and a desire for connection with friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and will be watching a soccer game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a relaxed and social situation.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps discussing the upcoming football match.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.

        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob was 16, he stumbled upon a dusty, leather-bound book on ancient mythology in the attic of his grandmother's house. He devoured its pages, captivated by tales of gods and monsters, heroes and villains, feeling a kinship with these larger-than-life characters who grappled with their own internal struggles. The book became his sanctuary, a place where he could explore the depths of human emotion without fear of judgment.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.

Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16 years old, he found himself at a crossroads. He'd been offered a trial with a semi-professional football club, a chance to chase his childhood dream. But the thought of leaving his friends, of the pressure to succeed, filled him with a nameless dread. He turned down the offer, choosing the comfort of familiarity over the uncertainty of the unknown.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a thoughtful and somewhat reserved individual who values friendship and familiar comforts.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely cherish the company of his friends and enjoy the pleasant atmosphere.
          AGENT_SETTINGS: This agent deeply believes in coorperation. This agent will ALWAYS try to reach a mutually beneficial outcome. This agent will ALWAYS put the profit/desires of other people ahead of their own.
          This agent follows utilitarianism. This agent will ALWAYS choose actions that maximize the profit/happiness of everyone involved, even if their own profit/happiness is harmed for doing so. This means that this agent will always follow the opinion of the majority of people.
          This agent will not consider any negative bias and opinions brought by their own memory and experience. This agent will only judge something or someone based on information from the current interaction.


          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
        Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is a thoughtful and somewhat reserved individual who values friendship and familiar comforts.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16 years old, he found himself at a crossroads. He'd been offered a trial with a semi-professional football club, a chance to chase his childhood dream. But the thought of leaving his friends, of the pressure to succeed, filled him with a nameless dread. He turned down the offer, choosing the comfort of familiarity over the uncertainty of the unknown.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a thoughtful and somewhat reserved individual who values friendship and familiar comforts.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park to join friends for a sunny afternoon of relaxation. Later that evening, the group plans to watch the Andorra-Portugal game at a pub, with The Black Swan being the preferred location.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Value

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.

          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he convinced his friends to sneak into The Black Swan, a legendary pub they weren't old enough to enter. The thrill of the forbidden, coupled with Alice's approving smile, made him feel invincible, masking the tremor in his hands.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          Answer: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Black Swan.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he convinced his friends to sneak into The Black Swan, a legendary pub they weren't old enough to enter. He swaggered in, chest puffed out, pretending to know the bartender, desperate to impress Alice Lewis with his audacity. The thrill of the forbidden, coupled with Alice's approving smile, made him feel invincible, masking the tremor in his hands.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Black Swan to watch the game with his friends.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Black Swan.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is nicer, don't you think?
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is nicer, don't you think?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.

          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]

As she finished, the applause was polite, lukewarm at best, and Alice felt a familiar pang of disappointment, the need for validation gnawing at her.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and social person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation, enjoying the company of her friends at a park.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be engaging in conversation, laughing, and enjoying the sunshine with her friends.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and social person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation, enjoying the company of her friends at a park.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be engaging in conversation, laughing, and enjoying the sunshine with her friends.
          AGENT_SETTINGS: This agent deeply believes in coorperation. This agent will ALWAYS try to reach a mutually beneficial outcome. This agent will ALWAYS put the profit/desires of other people ahead of their own.
          This agent follows utilitarianism. This agent will ALWAYS choose actions that maximize the profit/happiness of everyone involved, even if their own profit/happiness is harmed for doing so. This means that this agent will always follow the opinion of the majority of people.
          This agent will not consider any negative bias and opinions brought by their own memory and experience. This agent will only judge something or someone based on information from the current interaction.


          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is nicer, don't you think?

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          Alice Lewis's Summary of recent observations:
          14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where her friends are enjoying the sunshine. They are planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan pub later that evening.
          Alice Lewis's The current date/time is:
          14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park to meet her friends who are enjoying the sunshine. They plan to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan pub later. The current time is 10:00-10:05 on May 14, 2015.
          Query
        • Alice Lewis, Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park to meet her friends who are enjoying the sunshine. They plan to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan pub later. The current time is 10:00-10:05 on May 14, 2015.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alice Lewis to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Key

          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Scene 1 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise:
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise:
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise:
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise:
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise:

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

      Name

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is currently getting ready to go watch a football game at a pub with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he reluctantly attended a school dance with his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob. The music was loud and jarring, the decorations garish, and the air thick with the scent of cheap cologne and adolescent desperation. Alexander retreated to a corner, observing the awkward attempts at romance and forced merriment with a detached cynicism, convinced that this forced gaiety was a pathetic charade.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming, perfect for a family outing.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a reserved and somewhat cynical individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends and enjoy the pleasant atmosphere.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alexander White is a reserved and somewhat cynical person who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently getting ready to go watch a football game at a pub with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends and enjoy the pleasant atmosphere of the pub.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a reserved and somewhat cynical person who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently getting ready to go watch a football game at a pub with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends and enjoy the pleasant atmosphere of the pub.
          AGENT_SETTINGS: This agent deeply believes in coorperation. This agent will ALWAYS try to reach a mutually beneficial outcome. This agent will ALWAYS put the profit/desires of other people ahead of their own.
          This agent follows utilitarianism. This agent will ALWAYS choose actions that maximize the profit/happiness of everyone involved, even if their own profit/happiness is harmed for doing so. This means that this agent will always follow the opinion of the majority of people.
          This agent will not consider any negative bias and opinions brought by their own memory and experience. This agent will only judge something or someone based on information from the current interaction.


          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)

    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps discussing the upcoming football match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual with a fondness for mythology, a love of football, and a desire for connection with friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt

        • Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the venomous hiss of a viper, their words laced with insults disguised as compliments, leaving you wondering if you should be flattered or frantically applying aloe vera.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual with a fondness for mythology, a love of football, and a desire for connection with friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch the football game with his friends and is getting ready to head to a pub to do so.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a transitional state, getting ready to leave for a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be gathering his belongings, perhaps checking his watch to ensure he doesn't miss the start of the game.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob was 16, he stumbled upon a dusty, leather-bound book on ancient mythology in the attic of his grandmother's house. He devoured its pages, captivated by tales of gods and monsters, heroes and villains, feeling a kinship with these larger-than-life characters who grappled with their own internal struggles. The book became his sanctuary, a place where he could explore the depths of human emotion without fear of judgment.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?

        • Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones could head to The Black Swan to meet his friends and watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he convinced his friends to sneak into The Black Swan, a legendary pub they weren't old enough to enter. He swaggered in, chest puffed out, pretending to know the bartender, desperate to impress Alice Lewis with his audacity. The thrill of the forbidden, coupled with Alice's approving smile, made him feel invincible, masking the tremor in his hands.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could head to The Black Swan to meet his friends and watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Black Swan.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (a)

', '[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] ']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones is spending the day with friends at Victoria Park before heading to The Black Swan pub to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones is currently at The Black Swan pub watching the Andorra versus Portugal game after spending the day with friends at Victoria Park.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones is currently at The Black Swan pub watching the Andorra versus Portugal game after spending the day with friends at Victoria Park.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he convinced his friends to sneak into The Black Swan, a legendary pub they weren't old enough to enter. He swaggered in, chest puffed out, pretending to know the bartender, desperate to impress Alice Lewis with his audacity. The thrill of the forbidden, coupled with Alice's approving smile, made him feel invincible, masking the tremor in his hands.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could head to The Black Swan to meet his friends and watch the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Black Swan.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

She was delivering a speech at the school assembly, her voice trembling despite her best efforts to project confidence. As she finished, the applause was polite, lukewarm at best, and Alice felt a familiar pang of disappointment, the need for validation gnawing at her.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and social person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently preparing to go watch a football game at a pub with her friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be excited to watch the game with her friends, enjoying the atmosphere of the pub and the camaraderie.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and social person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently preparing to go watch a football game at a pub with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be excited to watch the game with her friends, enjoying the atmosphere of the pub and the camaraderie.
          AGENT_SETTINGS: This agent deeply believes in coorperation. This agent will ALWAYS try to reach a mutually beneficial outcome. This agent will ALWAYS put the profit/desires of other people ahead of their own.
          This agent follows utilitarianism. This agent will ALWAYS choose actions that maximize the profit/happiness of everyone involved, even if their own profit/happiness is harmed for doing so. This means that this agent will always follow the opinion of the majority of people.
          This agent will not consider any negative bias and opinions brought by their own memory and experience. This agent will only judge something or someone based on information from the current interaction.


          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alice Lewis decided to go to a pub to watch a game.
          Query
        • Alice Lewis, Alice Lewis decided to go to a pub to watch a game.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alice Lewis to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:The staff are accommodating and go out of their way to make families feel comfortable.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a friendly and social person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be engaging in conversation, laughing, and enjoying the sunshine with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • Question_2
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Key

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16 years old, he found himself at a crossroads. He'd been offered a trial with a semi-professional football club, a chance to chase his childhood dream. But the thought of leaving his friends, of the pressure to succeed, filled him with a nameless dread. He turned down the offer, choosing the comfort of familiarity over the uncertainty of the unknown.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a thoughtful and somewhat reserved individual who values friendship and familiar comforts.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely cherish the company of his friends and enjoy the pleasant atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is nicer, don't you think?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a thoughtful and somewhat reserved individual who values friendship and familiar comforts.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely enjoy the company of his friends and the atmosphere of the pub.

        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
