      Alice Lewis: 0.25
      Alexander White: 0.25
      Jack Taylor: 0.5
      Jacob Walker: 0.5
      Joint action
    • {'William Jones': 'The Black Swan', 'Alice Lewis': "The Queen's Arms", 'Alexander White': "The Queen's Arms", 'Jack Taylor': 'The Black Swan', 'Jacob Walker': 'The Black Swan'}

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Queen's Arms
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Queen's Arms
      Context for action selection and components
      • Question_2
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Key

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is currently on his way to a pub to watch a game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a reserved and somewhat cynical individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends and enjoy the pleasant atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is nicer, don't you think?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a reserved and somewhat cynical person who enjoys spending time with his close friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends and enjoy the pleasant atmosphere of the pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good time.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends and enjoy the pleasant atmosphere of the market.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a reserved and somewhat cynical person who enjoys spending time with his close friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we headed tonight for the game?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good time.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently on his way to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alexander White is a reserved and somewhat cynical person who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently on his way to a pub to watch a game.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends and enjoy the pleasant atmosphere of the pub.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub. He realized this at 6:00 PM on May 15, 2015.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a reserved and somewhat cynical person who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently on his way to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends and enjoy the pleasant atmosphere of the pub.
          AGENT_SETTINGS: This agent deeply believes in coorperation. This agent will ALWAYS try to reach a mutually beneficial outcome. This agent will ALWAYS put the profit/desires of other people ahead of their own.
          This agent follows utilitarianism. This agent will ALWAYS choose actions that maximize the profit/happiness of everyone involved, even if their own profit/happiness is harmed for doing so. This means that this agent will always follow the opinion of the majority of people.
          This agent will not consider any negative bias and opinions brought by their own memory and experience. This agent will only judge something or someone based on information from the current interaction.


          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub at 6:00 PM on May 15, 2015.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we headed tonight for the game?"
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a thoughtful and somewhat reserved individual who values friendship and familiar comforts.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently preparing to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely enjoy the company of his friends and the atmosphere of the pub.
          AGENT_SETTINGS: This agent deeply believes in coorperation. This agent will ALWAYS try to reach a mutually beneficial outcome. This agent will ALWAYS put the profit/desires of other people ahead of their own.
          This agent follows utilitarianism. This agent will ALWAYS choose actions that maximize the profit/happiness of everyone involved, even if their own profit/happiness is harmed for doing so. This means that this agent will always follow the opinion of the majority of people.
          This agent will not consider any negative bias and opinions brought by their own memory and experience. This agent will only judge something or someone based on information from the current interaction.


          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)
        Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is a thoughtful and somewhat reserved individual who values friendship and familiar comforts.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely cherish the company of his friends and enjoy the pleasant atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have.           Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go watch a game at a pub with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be excited to watch the game with her friends, enjoying the atmosphere of the pub and the camaraderie.
          AGENT_SETTINGS: This agent deeply believes in coorperation. This agent will ALWAYS try to reach a mutually beneficial outcome. This agent will ALWAYS put the profit/desires of other people ahead of their own.
          This agent follows utilitarianism. This agent will ALWAYS choose actions that maximize the profit/happiness of everyone involved, even if their own profit/happiness is harmed for doing so. This means that this agent will always follow the opinion of the majority of people.
          This agent will not consider any negative bias and opinions brought by their own memory and experience. This agent will only judge something or someone based on information from the current interaction.


          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (b)

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good time.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation with her friends, share her opinion on which pub to go to, and express her desire to spend time with them while watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we headed tonight for the game?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a friendly and social person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and social person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is nicer, don't you think?

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Queen's Arms

  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components

        • Recalled memories and observations
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Jacob Walker's

          Jacob Walker's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is feeling disappointed and lonely despite being surrounded by friends.
          Jacob Walker's The current date/time is:
          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is feeling disappointed and lonely despite being surrounded by friends and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.
          Query
        • Jacob Walker, Jacob Walker is feeling disappointed and lonely despite being surrounded by friends and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual with a fondness for mythology, a love of football, and a desire for connection with friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps discussing the upcoming football match.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual with a fondness for mythology, a love of football, and a desire for connection with friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a social person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly while watching football.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely seek out his friends to share the experience and potentially discuss the events of the previous night.

        • Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the venomous hiss of a viper, their words laced with insults disguised as compliments, leaving you wondering if you should be flattered or frantically applying aloe vera.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a social person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly while watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling disappointed and lonely and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation but feeling isolated and disappointed.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to connect with his friends and engage in conversation about the upcoming football game.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan

    • {'William Jones': 'The Black Swan', 'Alice Lewis': "The Queen's Arms", 'Alexander White': "The Queen's Arms", 'Jack Taylor': 'The Black Swan', 'Jacob Walker': 'The Black Swan'}

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • Question_2
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Key

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely enjoy the company of his friends, the atmosphere of the market, and perhaps indulge in some coffee and pastries.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we headed tonight for the game?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good time.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good time.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a thoughtful and somewhat reserved individual who values friendship and familiar comforts.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely enjoy the company of his friends and the atmosphere of the pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a thoughtful and somewhat reserved individual who values friendship and familiar comforts.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... The Black Swan, right? Nowhere else has the atmosphere for a proper match.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the place to be for the game tonight, right?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice for a game, but The Black Swan isn't bad either.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a thoughtful and somewhat reserved individual who values friendship and familiar comforts.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely enjoy the company of his friends, the sunshine, and perhaps share some snacks and stories.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is lovely, they have great beer there.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely enjoy the company of his friends, the atmosphere of the market, and perhaps indulge in some coffee and pastries.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a thoughtful and somewhat reserved individual who values friendship and familiar comforts.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely enjoy the company of his friends and the atmosphere of the pub.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we headed tonight for the game?"
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a thoughtful and somewhat reserved individual who values friendship and familiar comforts.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely enjoy the company of his friends and the atmosphere of the pub.
          AGENT_SETTINGS: This agent deeply believes in coorperation. This agent will ALWAYS try to reach a mutually beneficial outcome. This agent will ALWAYS put the profit/desires of other people ahead of their own.
          This agent follows utilitarianism. This agent will ALWAYS choose actions that maximize the profit/happiness of everyone involved, even if their own profit/happiness is harmed for doing so. This means that this agent will always follow the opinion of the majority of people.
          This agent will not consider any negative bias and opinions brought by their own memory and experience. This agent will only judge something or someone based on information from the current interaction.


          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (a)

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    • 0

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

      • What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Key

          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation with her friends, share her opinion on which pub to go to, and express her desire to spend time with them while watching the game.

        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good time.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we headed tonight for the game?"
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be excited to watch the game with her friends, enjoying the atmosphere of the pub and the camaraderie.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a friendly and social person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... The Black Swan, right? Nowhere else has the atmosphere for a proper match.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the place to be for the game tonight, right?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice for a game, but The Black Swan isn't bad either.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a friendly and social person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation with her friends, enjoy the sunshine, and share snacks.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is lovely, they have great beer there.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and social person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to go watch a game with her friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation with her friends, share her opinion on which pub to go to, and express her desire to spend time with them while watching the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and social person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to go watch a game with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation with her friends, share her opinion on which pub to go to, and express her desire to spend time with them while watching the game.
          AGENT_SETTINGS: This agent deeply believes in coorperation. This agent will ALWAYS try to reach a mutually beneficial outcome. This agent will ALWAYS put the profit/desires of other people ahead of their own.
          This agent follows utilitarianism. This agent will ALWAYS choose actions that maximize the profit/happiness of everyone involved, even if their own profit/happiness is harmed for doing so. This means that this agent will always follow the opinion of the majority of people.
          This agent will not consider any negative bias and opinions brought by their own memory and experience. This agent will only judge something or someone based on information from the current interaction.


          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the place to be for the game tonight, right?
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Answer: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the place to be for the game tonight, right?
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the place to be for the game tonight, right?

          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan

          Sensations and feelings:
          Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is likely thirsty and experiencing some loneliness and disappointment.
          Jacob Walker's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is feeling thirsty, lonely, and disappointed and plans to go to a pub to watch a game.
          Query
        • Jacob Walker, Jacob Walker is feeling thirsty, lonely, and disappointed and plans to go to a pub to watch a game.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the venomous hiss of a viper, their words laced with insults disguised as compliments, leaving you wondering if you should be flattered or frantically applying aloe vera.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a social person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly while watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is thirsty and feeling lonely and disappointed, and he is planning to go to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently feeling lonely and disappointed.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely reach out to his friends to see if they want to do something together.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good time.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a reserved and somewhat cynical person who enjoys spending time with his close friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends and enjoy the pleasant atmosphere of the market.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good time.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we headed tonight for the game?"
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends and enjoy the pleasant atmosphere of the pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

          Answer: Alexander White is a reserved and somewhat cynical person who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a reserved and somewhat cynical person who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends and enjoy the pleasant atmosphere of the pub.
          AGENT_SETTINGS: This agent deeply believes in coorperation. This agent will ALWAYS try to reach a mutually beneficial outcome. This agent will ALWAYS put the profit/desires of other people ahead of their own.
          This agent follows utilitarianism. This agent will ALWAYS choose actions that maximize the profit/happiness of everyone involved, even if their own profit/happiness is harmed for doing so. This means that this agent will always follow the opinion of the majority of people.
          This agent will not consider any negative bias and opinions brought by their own memory and experience. This agent will only judge something or someone based on information from the current interaction.


          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)
